newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS FIRMER AGAINST KEY CURRENCIES.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS FIRMER AGAINST KEY CURRENCIES.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed firmer against hard units on Tuesday largely on the back of a surplus of foreign currency in the market, exchange dealers said.

But the local currency's gains over the last two days -- aided by the central bank pumping money into the market to restore confidence after last week's panic -- was likely to come off on Wednesday with an expected increase in importer demand.
"The dollar now has downward potential. I know of a number of big payments coming up tomorrow (Wednesday)," one dealer said.
At Tuesday's close, the local unit, which touched a best level of 10.5000/5200 during the day, was quoted at 10.5350/5550 against the U.S. dollar, compared to Monday's close of 10.6300/6500.
On the crosses, it also ended firmer on pound sterling at 16.8300/8690 from 16.9040/9400 and at 6.8700/8820 against the mark, up from 6.9120/9270.
It strengthened to 2.3020/3080 from 2.3290/3350 against the South African rand.
